Posted By: Cyberium (9/26/2012 8:52:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't think many people realize just how **crazy** this card really is. I'm thinking about tossing one copy into my RUG Delver build due to the fact that it runs 29 instants and sorceries; [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) deals 5, [Forked Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forked Bolt) deals 2 and 2 split, [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will) counters a spell for free and shocks, [Stifle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stifle) screws your opponent out of a fetchland and shocks, I can [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm) and shock, the list goes on and on.  
  
**Please** keep an eye on this guy because I guarantee he'll be around for a **long** time.
posts.html:

Posted By: BurningPhoenix85 (10/7/2012 12:59:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Agreeing with BurningPhoenix here. The sheer value that this guy can have is unbelievable. Made a standard budget UR draw-go ish deck w/ Delver, Goblin Electromancer, Guttersnipe, and a couple sideboarded Talrand. [Think Twice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Think Twice) and [Faithless Looting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faithless Looting) (my only sorcery) are just some of the spells that work tremendously with these two gobbos. New-Age (standard) RDW burn is now UR (or other) because of this guy.  
  
UR Electrosnipe vs. Goldfish  
T1: UR Shockland, [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets)  
T2: Flip Delver (~25+ instants/sorceries) Island, [Goblin Electromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Electromancer) Swing 3  
T3: Mountain, [Guttersnipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guttersnipe) Swing 5  
T4: [Sulfur Falls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sulfur Falls), Play any spells in hand: Think Twice into Searing Spear with 2 lands untapped (7 damage), dump hand for easy 10-20 damage total, then swing for ~7.  
  
Of course, you don't need a godhand to combo with Guttersnipe. Just an example of what he can do. Snapcaster adds furt... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Made a standard budget UR draw-go ish deck w/ Delver, Goblin Electromancer, Guttersnipe, and a couple sideboarded Talrand. Think Twice and Faithless Looting (my only sorcery) are just some of the spells that work tremendously with these two gobbos. New-Age (standard) RDW burn is now UR (or other) because of this guy.

UR Electrosnipe vs. Goldfish
T1: UR Shockland, Delver of Secrets
T2: Flip Delver (~25+ instants/sorceries) Island, Goblin Electromancer Swing 3
T3: Mountain, Guttersnipe Swing 5
T4: Sulfur Falls, Play any spells in hand: Think Twice into Searing Spear with 2 lands untapped (7 damage), dump hand for easy 10-20 damage total, then swing for ~7.

Of course, you don't need a godhand to combo with Guttersnipe. Just an example of what he can do. Snapcaster adds furt... (see all)

Posted By: XepherXero (9/26/2012 1:23:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you play this in a multiplayer game, you're painting a huge target on your head. Also, pure gold with rebound spells. [Staggershock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Staggershock) is particularly nice: a total of 8 damage for just ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)!  
  
He's somewhat comparable to [Gelectrode](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gelectrode) in a counterburn deck. He's a little beefier (and is capable of attacking if necessary), only needs one color, and he hurts your opponents a little more, but he can't be used to snipe creatures and only works when you actually cast your spells. I think I prefer Gelectrode a little more overall for its versatility and for being so much more endearing (I like to call it Squishy; what the heck can I call this?) but this guy does his job very nicely as well.
posts.html:

He's somewhat comparable to Gelectrode in a counterburn deck. He's a little beefier (and is capable of attacking if necessary), only needs one color, and he hurts your opponents a little more, but he can't be used to snipe creatures and only works when you actually cast your spells. I think I prefer Gelectrode a little more overall for its versatility and for being so much more endearing (I like to call it Squishy; what the heck can I call this?) but this guy does his job very nicely as well.

Posted By: Purplerooster (10/10/2012 8:18:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
U/R delver has a new, overwhelming, "staple" friend. I am very happy with my playset already...
  
   
Combine with [tandem lookout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tandem lookout) and [think twice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=think twice) for fun combos. Draw a card each time you cast think twice, plus two damage and the actual think twice draw. Then flashback for even more fun.
  
   
Also, [spelltwine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spelltwine) gets honorable mention for 6 damage for one card, and thats with only a single guttersnipe. Even more shenanigans are available with [epic experiment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=epic experiment), replicate and storm... And multiplayer gets lots of use from this guy too.
  
   
Get a few of these on the field at the same time and cast everything ever! Oh, and [nivmagus elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=nivmagus elemental) gets lots of credit since the spells you exile are on the stack already, so guttersnipe still gets his proc(and potential card draw with tandem lookout). Very scary potential.
posts.html:
U/R delver has a new, overwhelming, "staple" friend. I am very happy with my playset already...

Combine with tandem lookout and think twice for fun combos. Draw a card each time you cast think twice, plus two damage and the actual think twice draw. Then flashback for even more fun.

Also, spelltwine gets honorable mention for 6 damage for one card, and thats with only a single guttersnipe. Even more shenanigans are available with epic experiment, replicate and storm... And multiplayer gets lots of use from this guy too.

Get a few of these on the field at the same time and cast everything ever! Oh, and nivmagus elemental gets lots of credit since the spells you exile are on the stack already, so guttersnipe still gets his proc(and potential card draw with tandem lookout). Very scary potential.

posts.post_content: Guttersnipe, [Nivmagus elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nivmagus elemental) and [goblin electromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=goblin electromancer) in the same set...Between the three I can cast my counterspells ([negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=negate) and [essence scatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=essence scatter) for one U. The one blue mana can counter and burn for 2 or burn and grant my nivmagus two +1/+1 counters. Crazy cheap and fast.
